Name: Howard University - S2P Lite
Deal_Acceleration_Summary__c:
Date: 31-10-2025

Opportunity Diagnosis & Executive Summary for Howard University

1. Opportunity History Summary (as of 2025-10-31)

  • No business problem has been documented, creating a critical gap in aligning Zycus’ value proposition.
  • No compelling event has been identified, weakening urgency and delaying decision-making.
  • No competitive intelligence or objections have been recorded, increasing risk of late-stage surprises.
  • Only active engagement: KC to coordinate a session with Raul Howard (Chief Product Officer); deadline missed as of 2025-10-31.
  • No key milestones or progress markers have been recorded, indicating poor visibility and accountability.
  • Risk level is high due to lack of urgency drivers, stakeholder engagement, and competitive awareness.

2. Market Research Summary

  • Howard University is finalizing a new strategic plan in 2025 focused on “Maximum Strength,” emphasizing procurement modernization and operational efficiency.
  • A $785M capital investment plan is underway, with major construction projects completing by 2026—creating a compelling event for procurement transformation.
  • The 2024 audit identified a “significant deficiency in internal controls,” highlighting an urgent need for improved financial tracking and compliance.
  • Procurement is a top priority in the new plan, with goals to improve efficiency, customer service, and automation.
  • President Vinson has explicitly called for digital transformation and AI integration—Zycus’ AI-powered procurement aligns directly with this vision.

3. Digital Engagement Summary

  • Top Visited Pages: None (Web traffic = 0 in last 30 days)
  • Buyer Intent Keywords: None detected
  • Visit Patterns: No recent engagement or digital activity from Howard University

4. Playbook Alignment Analysis

Completed Requirements:

  • Opportunity is marked as “Qualified” in CRM.
  • One follow-up action was attempted (meeting with Raul Howard), though not completed.

Pending Steps:

  • No documented discovery calls or pain point validation.
  • No BANT qualification completed (Budget, Authority, Need, Timeline).
  • No multi-threaded relationships or champions identified.
  • No executive engagement or Zycus leadership involvement.
  • No nurturing plan or regular touchpoints established.
  • No RFI/RFP influence or pre-sales engagement initiated.
  • No documentation of interactions or milestones in CRM.

5. BANT Qualifying Identifiers

  • B (Budget) – Not Qualified: No evidence of budget allocation or business case development has been documented.
  • A (Authority) – Not Qualified: No decision-makers or evaluators have been engaged; session with CPO was planned but not executed.
  • N (Need) – Not Qualified: No business problem or pain points have been identified or validated.
  • T (Timeline) – Qualified: Close date is set for March 2026, aligning with Howard’s capital project timelines and strategic plan finalization.

6. Final Recommendations for Deal Acceleration

Critical Next Steps + Risk Mitigation Plan

Due Date: 2025-11-07

  • Immediately follow up with Anjanette to reschedule the session with Raul Howard. Escalate via executive outreach if needed.
  • Conduct a structured discovery session to define and validate the business problem. Use Howard’s audit findings and capital project timelines as entry points.
  • Identify a compelling event—tie Zycus’ value to the 2026 capital project deadlines and 2025 strategic plan finalization.
  • Map the organizational structure and identify key decision-makers in Procurement, Finance, and IT. Initiate multi-threaded engagement.
  • Establish and document key milestones in CRM to improve visibility and accountability.
  • Launch a competitive landscape assessment to uncover potential threats and position Zycus’ differentiators (AI, compliance, automation).

Due Date: 2025-11-21

  • Develop a customized nurturing plan with bi-weekly check-ins.
  • Share tailored thought leadership content on procurement modernization in higher education.
  • Introduce Zycus leadership to Howard’s executive stakeholders to build trust and alignment.

Due Date: 2025-12-15

  • Initiate pre-sales engagement to prepare for potential RFI/RFP.
  • Share Zycus’ compliance and audit-readiness capabilities to address internal control deficiencies.
  • Position Zycus as a strategic partner in Howard’s digital transformation and AI roadmap.

Best Talking Points for Zycus' Leadership

Key Conversation Focus Areas:

  • Addressing the “significant deficiency in internal controls” with Zycus’ audit-ready procurement platform.
  • Supporting Howard’s $785M capital investment with project procurement, supplier risk management, and contract lifecycle automation.
  • Enabling “Maximum Efficiency” and “Customer Service” in procurement through intelligent automation.
  • Aligning with Howard’s AI and digital transformation goals via Zycus’ AI-powered procurement suite.

Confidence-Building Factors:

  • Proven success in higher education and public sector compliance.
  • Robust audit trails and Uniform Guidance alignment.
  • AI-driven insights for sourcing, spend analysis, and supplier management.
  • Seamless ERP integration and low-disruption implementation methodology.

Uncertainties:

  • No confirmation of budget ownership or allocation.
  • No clarity on who the decision-makers or champions are.
  • No visibility into competitive landscape or evaluation criteria.
  • No digital engagement or buyer intent signals detected.

By addressing these gaps and aligning with Howard University’s strategic imperatives, Zycus can reposition this opportunity for accelerated progression and long-term partnership.
